questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Considering only the principal values of the inverse trigonometric functions, the value of tan^(-1)(sin^(-1)(11/32) - 2cos^(-1)(5/5)) is
questions.topic: Principal values of inverse trigonometric functions
questions.concept: Evaluation of composite inverse trigonometric expressions

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let S = {(x,y): x ≥ 0, y ≥ 0, y ≤ 4x, y ≥ 12 - 2x and 3x + 8y ≤ 58}. If the area of the region S is λ/2, then λ is equal to
questions.topic: Area of regions bounded by linear inequalities

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let k ∈ ℝ. If lim(x→0+) [e^(kx) / (sin(sin x) + cos x - x)] = 0, then the value of k is
questions.concept: Limits involving exponential and trigonometric functions

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let f: ℝ → ℝ be a function defined by f(x) = {(2sin x)/x if x ≠ 0, 0 if x = 0}. Then which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.text: f(x) = 0 has infinitely many solutions in the interval (-1/10, 1/10)
f(x) = 0 has no solutions in the interval (-π, π)
The set of solutions of f(x) = 0 in the interval [0, 1/10] is finite
f(x) = 0 has more than 25 solutions in the interval (-1/2, 1/2)

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let S be the set of all (α, β) such that lim(x→1) [sin(α + β)(log_e x)^2 + sin α] / [log_e(1 + x)] = 0. Then which of the following is (are) correct?

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: A straight line drawn from the point P(1, 3, 2), parallel to the line (x-2)/1 = (y-4)/(-2) = (z-6)/1, intersects the plane L₁: x - 3y + 6z = 1 at the point Q. Another straight line which passes through Q and is perpendicular to the plane L₁ intersects the plane L₂: x - 2y + z = -4 at the point R. Then which of the following statements is (are) TRUE?

options.text: The length of the line segment PQ is √6
The centroid of the triangle PQR is (4/3, 14/3, 5/3)
The perimeter of the triangle PQR is 2√6 + √11

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let A₁, B₁, C₁ be three points in the xy-plane. Suppose that the lines A₁C₁ and B₁C₁ are tangents to the curve y² = 8x at A₁ and B₁, respectively. If O = (0, 0) and C₁ = (-4, 0), then which of the following statements is (are) TRUE?

options.text: The length of the line segment OA₁ is 4√3
The length of the line segment A₁B₁ is 16
The orthocenter of the triangle A₁B₁C₁ is (0, 0)
The orthocenter of the triangle A₁B₁C₁ is (1, 0)

questions.concept: Tangents to parabola from external point

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let f: ℝ → ℝ be a function such that f(x + y) = f(x) + f(y) for all x, y ∈ ℝ, and g: (0, ∞) → ℝ be a function such that g(xy) = g(x)g(y) for all x, y. If f(-3/12) = -1/2 and g(5/3) = 2, then the value of f(1) + 2g(√8) - 4g(0) is

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: A bag contains N balls out of which 3 balls are white, 6 balls are green, and the remaining balls are blue. Three balls are drawn randomly one after the other without replacement. For i = 1, 2, 3, let Wᵢ, Gᵢ, Bᵢ denote the events that the ball drawn in the i-th draw is white, green, blue respectively. If P(W₁G₂B₃) = 2/5N and P(B₃|W₁G₂) = 2/9, then N equals
questions.topic: Conditional probability and drawing without replacement

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let the function f: ℝ → ℝ be defined by f(x) = ((x^2023 + x^2023)sin(2x) + (x^2024 + x^2025)cos(3x))/(e^x - e^(-x) + (x^2024 + x^2025)). Then the number of solutions of f(x) = 0 in ℝ is
questions.concept: Analysis of rational functions with exponential terms

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let p̂ = 2î + 3ĵ + k̂ and q̂ = î - ĵ + k̂. If for some real numbers α, β, γ, and δ, we have (α + β)p̂ + (γ + δ)q̂ = p̂ × q̂ + 15î + 10ĵ + 6k̂ + 2(p̂ - q̂), then the value of αδ is

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: A normal with slope 1/6 is drawn from the point (0, λ) to the parabola x² = -4ay, where a > 0. Let L be the line passing through (0, λ) and parallel to the directrix of the parabola. Suppose that L intersects the parabola at two points A and B. Let r denote the length of the latus rectum and s denote the square of the length of the line segment AB. If r:s = 1:16, then the value of 24a is
questions.concept: Normal to parabola and latus rectum

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: Let the function f: [1, ∞) → ℝ be defined by a piecewise formula involving floor functions. Define g(x) = ∫₁ˣ f(t)dt, x ∈ (1, ∞). Let α denote the number of solutions of g(x) = 0 in (1, 8] and β = lim(x→1⁺) g(x)/(x-1). Then the value of α + β is equal to
questions.concept: Fundamental theorem of calculus with floor functions

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: If n(X) = ₘC₆, then the value of m is

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: If the value of n(Y) + n(Z) is k², then |k| is

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: The value of ∫₀^(π/2) [2f(x)g(x) - g(x)]dx is
questions.concept: Integration involving trigonometric and algebraic functions

questions.subject: MATHEMATICS
questions.questionText: The value of (16/π³) ∫₀^(π/2) f(x)g(x)dx is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A region in the form of an equilateral triangle (in x-y plane) of height L has a uniform magnetic field B⃗ pointing in the +z-direction. A conducting loop PQR, in the form of an equilateral triangle of the same height L, is placed in the x-y plane with its vertex P at x = 0. At t=0, the loop starts entering the region of the magnetic field with a uniform velocity v along the +x-direction. Which of the following graph best depicts the variation of the induced emf (E) in the loop as a function of the distance (x) starting from x = 0?
questions.concept: EMF in moving conductor in magnetic field

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A particle of mass m is under the influence of the gravitational field of a body of mass M (≫m). The particle is moving in a circular orbit of radius r₀ with time period T₀ around the mass M. Then, the particle is subjected to an additional central force, corresponding to the potential energy Vc(r) = mα/r³, where α is a positive constant. If the particle moves in the same circular orbit but with new time period T₁, then (T₁² - T₀²)/T₁² is given by [G is the gravitational constant.]
questions.topic: Orbital mechanics with additional central force

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A metal target with atomic number Z=46 is bombarded with a high energy electron beam. The emission of X-rays from the target is analyzed. The ratio r of the wavelengths of the Kα-line and the cut-off is found to be r = 2. If the same electron beam bombards another metal target with Z =41, the value of r will be
questions.concept: Characteristic X-rays and continuous X-ray spectrum

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A thin stiff insulated metal wire is bent into a circular loop with its two ends extending tangentially from the same point of the loop. The wire loop has mass m and radius r and it is in a uniform vertical magnetic field B₀. Initially, it hangs vertically downwards, because of acceleration due to gravity g, on two conducting supports at P and Q. When a current I is passed through the loop, the loop turns about the line PQ by an angle θ given by
questions.concept: Torque on current loop in magnetic field

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A small electric dipole p₀, having a moment of inertia I about its center, is kept at a distance r from the center of a spherical shell of radius R. The surface charge density is uniformly distributed on the spherical shell. The dipole is initially oriented at a small angle θ. While staying at distance r, the dipole is free to rotate about its center. If released from rest, then which of the following statement(s) is(are) correct? [ε₀ is the permittivity of free space.]

options.text: The dipole will undergo small oscillations at any finite value of r.
The dipole will undergo small oscillations at any finite value of r > R.
The dipole will undergo small oscillations with an angular frequency of √(2σp₀/(ε₀I)) at r = 2R.
The dipole will undergo small oscillations with an angular frequency of √(σp₀/(100ε₀I)) at r = 10R.

questions.concept: Oscillations of dipole in uniform electric field

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A table tennis ball has radius (3/2)×10⁻² m and mass (22/7)×10⁻³ kg. It is slowly pushed down into a swimming pool to a depth of d=0.7 m below the water surface and then released from rest. It emerges from the water surface at speed v, without getting wet, and rises up to a height H. Which of the following option(s) is(are) correct? [Given: π=22/7, g=10 m s⁻², density of water =1×10³ kg m⁻³, viscosity of water =1×10⁻³ Pa-s.]

options.text: The work done in pushing the ball to the depth d is 0.077 J.
If we neglect the viscous force in water, then the speed v=7 m/s.
If we neglect the viscous force in water, then the height H=1.4 m.
The ratio of the magnitudes of the net force excluding the viscous force to the maximum viscous force in water is 500/9.

questions.concept: Motion of sphere in fluid with buoyancy

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A positive, singly ionized atom of mass number A_M is accelerated from rest by the voltage 192 V. Thereafter, it enters a rectangular region of width w with magnetic field B₀=0.1k̂ Tesla. The ion finally hits a detector at the distance x below its starting trajectory. [Given: Mass of neutron/proton =(5/3)×10⁻²⁷ kg, charge of the electron =1.6× 10⁻¹⁹ C.] Which of the following option(s) is(are) correct?

options.text: The value of x for H⁺ ion is 4 cm.
The value of x for an ion with A_M=144 is 48 cm.
For detecting ions with 1≤A_M≤196, the minimum height (x₁-x₀) of the detector is 55 cm.
The minimum width w of the region of the magnetic field for detecting ions with A_M=196 is 56 cm.

questions.topic: Motion of charged particles in magnetic field
questions.concept: Deflection of ions in magnetic field

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The dimensions of a cone are measured using a scale with a least count of 2 mm. The diameter of the base and the height are both measured to be 20.0 cm. The maximum percentage error in the determination of the volume is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A ball is thrown from the location (x₀,y₀)=(0,0) of a horizontal playground with an initial speed v₀ at an angle θ₀ from the +x-direction. The ball is to be hit by a stone, which is thrown at the same time from the location (x₁,y₁)=(L,0). The stone is thrown at an angle (180−θ₁) from the +x-direction with a suitable initial speed. For a fixed v₀, when (θ₀,θ₁)=(45°,45°), the stone hits the ball after time T₁, and when (θ₀,θ₁)=(60°,30°), it hits the ball after time T₂. In such a case, (T₁/T₂)² is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A charge is kept at the central point P of a cylindrical region. The two edges subtend a half-angle α at P. When α = 30°, then the electric flux through the curved surface of the cylinder is Φ. If α = 60°, then the electric flux through the curved surface becomes Φ/√n, where the value of n is
questions.concept: Flux through curved surface of cylinder

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two equilateral-triangular prisms P₁ and P₂ are kept with their sides parallel to each other, in vacuum. A light ray enters prism P₁ at an angle of incidence θ such that the outgoing ray undergoes minimum deviation in prism P₂. If the respective refractive indices of P₁ and P₂ are √3/2 and √3, then θ=sin⁻¹[√3/2 sin(π/β)], where the value of β is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An infinitely long thin wire, having a uniform charge density per unit length of 5 nC/m, is passing through a spherical shell of radius 1 m. A 10 nC charge is distributed uniformly over the spherical shell. If the configuration of the charges remains static, the magnitude of the potential difference between points P and R, in Volt, is [Given: In SI units 1/(4πε₀)=9×10⁹, ln2=0.7. Ignore the area pierced by the wire.]
questions.concept: Potential due to line charge and spherical charge distribution

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A spherical soap bubble inside an air chamber at pressure P₀=10⁵ Pa has a certain radius so that the excess pressure inside the bubble is ΔP=144 Pa. Now, the chamber pressure is reduced to 8P₀/27 so that the bubble radius and its excess pressure change. In this process, all the temperatures remain unchanged. Assume air to be an ideal gas and the excess pressure ΔP in both the cases to be much smaller than the chamber pressure. The new excess pressure ΔP in Pa is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: In a Young's double slit experiment, each of the two slits A and B are oscillating about their fixed center and with a mean separation of 0.8 mm. The distance between the slits at time t is given by d=(0.8+0.04sinωt) mm, where ω=0.08 rad s⁻¹. The distance of the screen from the slits is 1 m and the wavelength of the light used to illuminate the slits is 6000 Å. The 8th bright fringe above the point O oscillates with time between two extreme positions. The separation between these two extreme positions, in micrometer (μm), is
questions.concept: Variable slit separation and fringe position

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The maximum speed in μm/s at which the 8th bright fringe will move is
questions.concept: Rate of change of fringe position

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two particles, 1 and 2, each of mass m, are connected by a massless spring, and are on a horizontal frictionless plane. Initially, the two particles, with their center of mass at x₀, are oscillating with amplitude a and angular frequency ω. Particle 3 of mass m moves towards this system with speed u₀=aω/2, and undergoes instantaneous elastic collision with particle 2, at time t₀. If the collision occurs at time t₀=0, the value of v_cm/(aω) will be
questions.concept: Elastic collision with center of mass motion

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: If the collision occurs at time t₀=π/(2ω), then the value of 4b²/a² will be

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: According to Bohr's model, the highest kinetic energy is associated with the electron in the
questions.concept: Kinetic energy of electrons in different orbits

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: In a metal deficient oxide sample, MₓY₂O₄ (M and Y are metals), M is present in both +2 and +3 oxidation states and Y is in +3 oxidation state. If the fraction of M²⁺ ions present in M is 1/3, the value of X is
questions.concept: Metal deficient oxides and oxidation states

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: In the following reaction sequence, the major product Q is [includes organic reaction scheme]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The species formed on fluorination of phosphorus pentachloride in a polar organic solvent are

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: An aqueous solution of hydrazine (N₂H₄) is electrochemically oxidized by O₂, thereby releasing chemical energy in the form of electrical energy. One of the products generated from the electrochemical reaction is N₂(g). Choose the correct statement(s) about the above process

options.text: OH⁻ ions react with N₂H₄ at the anode to form N₂(g) and water, releasing 4 electrons to the anode.
At the cathode, N₂H₄ breaks to N₂(g) and nascent hydrogen released at the electrode reacts with oxygen to form water.
At the cathode, molecular oxygen gets converted to OH⁻.
Oxides of nitrogen are major by-products of the electrochemical process.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The option(s) with correct sequence of reagents for the conversion of P to Q is(are) [includes organic reaction scheme]

options.text: i) Lindlar's catalyst, H₂; ii) SnCl₂/HCl; iii) NaBH₄; iv) H₃O⁺
i) Lindlar's catalyst, H₂; ii) H₃O⁺; iii) SnCl₂/HCl; iv) NaBH₄
i) NaBH₄; ii) SnCl₂/HCl; iii) H₃O⁺; iv) Lindlar's catalyst, H₂
i) Lindlar's catalyst, H₂; ii) NaBH₄; iii) SnCl₂/HCl; iv) H₃O⁺

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The compound(s) having peroxide linkage is(are)

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: To form a complete monolayer of acetic acid on 1g of charcoal, 100 mL of 0.5 M acetic acid was used. Some of the acetic acid remained unadsorbed. To neutralize the unadsorbed acetic acid, 40 mL of 1 M NaOH solution was required. If each molecule of acetic acid occupies P × 10⁻²³ m² surface area on charcoal, the value of P is [Use given data: Surface area of charcoal = 1.5 × 10² m²g⁻¹; Avogadro's number (Nₐ) = 6.0 × 10²³ mol⁻¹]
questions.concept: Monolayer adsorption and surface area calculation

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Vessel-1 contains w₂ g of a non-volatile solute X dissolved in w₁ g of water. Vessel-2 contains w₂ g of another non-volatile solute Y dissolved in w₁ g of water. Both the vessels are at the same temperature and pressure. The molar mass of X is 80% of that of Y. The van't Hoff factor for X is 1.2 times of that of Y for their respective concentrations. The elevation of boiling point for solution in Vessel-1 is _____ % of the solution in Vessel-2.
questions.concept: Elevation of boiling point and van't Hoff factor

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For a double strand DNA, one strand is given. The amount of energy required to split the double strand DNA into two single strands is _____ kcal mol⁻¹. [Given: Average energy per H-bond for A-T base pair = 1.0 kcal mol⁻¹, G-C base pair = 1.5 kcal mol⁻¹, and A-U base pair = 1.25 kcal mol⁻¹. Ignore electrostatic repulsion between the phosphate groups.]
questions.concept: Hydrogen bonding in DNA base pairs

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: A sample initially contains only U-238 isotope of uranium. With time, some of the U-238 radioactively decays into Pb-206 while the rest of it remains undisintegrated. When the age of the sample is P×10⁸ years, the ratio of mass of Pb-206 to that of U-238 in the sample is found to be 7. The value of P is [Given: Half-life of U-238 is 4.5 ×10⁹ years; logₑ2 = 0.693]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Among [Co(CN)₄]⁴⁻, [Co(CO)₃(NO)], XeF₄, [PCl₄]⁺, [PdCl₄]²⁻, [ICl₄]⁻, [Cu(CN)₄]³⁻ and P₄ the total number of species with tetrahedral geometry is

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: An organic compound P having molecular formula C₆H₆O₃ gives ferric chloride test and does not have intramolecular hydrogen bond. The compound P reacts with 3 equivalents of NH₂OH to produce oxime Q. Treatment of P with excess methyl iodide in the presence of KOH produces compound R as the major product. Reaction of R with excess iso-butylmagnesium bromide followed by treatment with H₃O⁺ gives compound S as the major product. The total number of methyl (−CH₃) group(s) in compound S is
questions.concept: Multi-step organic synthesis and structural determination

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: An organic compound P with molecular formula C₉H₁₈O₂ decolorizes bromine water and also shows positive iodoform test. P on ozonolysis followed by treatment with H₂O₂ gives Q and R. While compound Q shows positive iodoform test, compound R does not give positive iodoform test. Q and R on oxidation with pyridinium chlorochromate (PCC) followed by heating give S and T, respectively. Both S and T show positive iodoform test. Sum of number of oxygen atoms in S and T is

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Complete copolymerization of 500 moles of Q and 500 moles of R gives one mole of a single acyclic copolymer U. The molecular weight of U is [Given, atomic mass: H =1, C = 12, O =16]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: When potassium iodide is added to an aqueous solution of potassium ferricyanide, a reversible reaction is observed in which a complex P is formed. In a strong acidic medium, the equilibrium shifts completely towards P. Addition of zinc chloride to P in a slightly acidic medium results in a sparingly soluble complex Q. The number of moles of potassium iodide required to produce two moles of P is

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The number of zinc ions present in the molecular formula of Q is
